Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; from top, part of lotus bud in faded added white outline; billet pattern in added red and white between white bands; traces of red and white floral pattern; exterior: on left, chest with red patches of possible sphinx to right; on right, part of tail and hind end of bull to right; elaborate rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as coming from a light-walled and big chalice belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice kraters. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 90, p. 261, no. 519)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1555) (phase 2)
